message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.DS 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with the problem of minimizing transmission completion time for a given number of bits per user in an energy harvesting communication system. This involves the study of achievable rate regions and capacity regions, which are key concepts in information theory. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper deals with scheduling packets on a broadcast link, which is a fundamental problem in networking. The use of energy harvesting in the system also makes it relevant to the sub-category of energy-efficient networking. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper involves the design of a scheduler for an energy harvesting communication system, which can be viewed as a control problem. The use of optimization techniques and the study of convergence properties also make it relevant to this sub-category. 
4. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper deals with the transmission of data (bits) over a communication channel, which is a key aspect of multimedia systems. The use of energy harvesting in the system also makes it relevant to the sub-category of energy-efficient multimedia systems. 
5. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper proposes an iterative offline algorithm for solving the scheduling problem, which involves the design and analysis of algorithms. The use of optimization techniques and the study of convergence properties also make it relevant to this sub-category.
